Answer the following quesiton in a better way.
How does your project differ from similar ones?\*
We would answer this question from the perspective of what is happening in Mexico. In the last year, we have seen a growing community. More people are involved in projects, more people are getting on board and maybe the best part, most people are walking with strong core values about the ecosystem. 

Last year we had two big events in the country. ETHMexico, run by ETHGlobal and Blockchainland, run by a private entity. Both events got more than 700 attendees.

This year, the only big event confirmed about blockchain is BlockchainLand, so we, as the Ethereum México Community Team, believe that the most important event about Web3 should not be a private one. We aim to make an event created by the community for the community, with workshops and talks about how Ethereum and all the protocols built on it could bring new tools and opportunities for the people.

To improve the answer to the question, “How does your project differ from similar ones?” the following could be added:
Our project differs from similar ones in Mexico in several key ways. Firstly, unlike the two big events held in the country last year, which were run by ETHGlobal and a private entity, respectively, our event is being created by the Ethereum Mexico Community Team, with a focus on community building and education. We believe that the most important event about Web3 should be created by the community for the community, and that workshops and talks about how Ethereum and all the protocols built on it could bring new tools and opportunities for the people are essential.
Secondly, our event aims to highlight the strong core values of the Ethereum ecosystem in Mexico. In the past year, we have seen a growing community of people who are involved in projects and getting on board with the Ethereum ecosystem. We believe that our event will provide an opportunity for attendees to network and collaborate with others who share their passion and values for Ethereum.
Lastly, our event is focused on accessibility and affordability for the Mexican people. We recognize that many individuals in Mexico are interested in learning about the Ethereum ecosystem but cannot afford to attend events in other parts of the world. By hosting an event in Mexico City, we are providing a more accessible and affordable option for individuals who want to learn about Ethereum and its potential to transform industries beyond finance.

After the grant is completed, we plan to continue organizing community events, workshops, and talks to further promote the Ethereum ecosystem and its potential in Mexico. We aim to strengthen our network of builders, developers, and enthusiasts and create more opportunities for collaboration and knowledge sharing. We also plan to continue our partnership with the Ethereum Foundation and explore additional funding opportunities to support our community-building efforts.
1. How do you aim to be sustainable after the grant? Alternatively, tell us why this project doesn’t need to be sustainable!
To be sustainable after the grant, we plan to explore additional funding opportunities and revenue streams to support our ongoing community-building efforts. By fostering a strong community of builders, developers, and enthusiasts, we believe that we can contribute to the growth and development of the Ethereum ecosystem in a sustainable and meaningful way.

Requested amount\*

We are requesting a grant of 20k USD from the Ethereum Foundation, but we are open to discussing different grant amounts that align with our project goals and budget.
